description.value:
Meese, Rhoden, and Psyrat

Element Mind

Attribute Modifiers Str -1, Dex +3, Con +2, Int +0, Wis +4, Cha +1

Eldamon Language Astral

Eldamon Hit Points 4

Eldamon Skills Acrobatics, Intimidation, Stealth

Eldamon Saving Throw Will

Senses low-light vision

Resistance electricity, light, mind, teleportation

Weaknesses darkness, sonic, spirit, time

Speed 25 feet

Melee 1 tail (agile, finesse, reach 20 feet when evolved only); Damage 1d4 bludgeoning plus 1 mental (1d6 bludgeoning plus 1 mental when evolved only)

Evolution Condition Helping meese reach a pinnacle in their love for gemstones (such as by finding a truly amazing gem or completing a collection of different gems).

Elemental Ability @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.eldamon-features.Item.qZqrUQbBplSjEbrv]{Exploit Lapse}Your mind powers deal more damage to creatures whose mind is vulnerable due to being befuddled or afraid. You gain a status bonus to damage with your mind powers equal to the highest of a creature’s stupefied value from any source or their frightened value they received from your mind powers, your Demoralize, or your mortal friend’s Demoralize if you’re an eldamon, to a maximum of +2. If you’re an expert in power DCs, the maximum status bonus to damage with your mind powers is +3. If you’re a master, the status bonus increases by 1 as long as a creature is either frightened or stupefied at any value, to a total maximum of +5, and if you’re legendary, the status bonus increases by a total of 2 as long as a creature is frightened or stupefied at any value, to a total maximum of +6.

Form Ability @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.eldamon-features.Item.Gy5ILwWf8DABKI8d]{Amethyst Sled}You use a mind amethyst to sled across scattered rubble, sand, or snow with ease. You ignore difficult terrain from rubble, sand, or snow.

Evolution Ability @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.eldamon-features.Item.K8B5EiosL97u0Buo]{Quadruple Tails}Your tails split into four spiralling tails, increasing their reach to 20 feet. Additionally, your four tails help you steady your increasingly powerful amethyst sled, allowing you ignore all difficult terrain on the ground, not just difficult terrain from rubble, sand, or snow.

Attribute Modifier Progression

Advanced Training (5th) Str +0, Dex +3, Con +3, Int +1, Wis +4, Cha +2

Eldamon Evolution (11th) Str +0, Dex +4, Con +4, Int +1, Wis +5, Cha +2

Apex Training (15th) Str +1, Dex +5, Con +4, Int +2, Wis +5, Cha +3

Final Attribute Boost (17th) Str +1, Dex +5, Con +4, Int +2, Wis +6, Cha +3
This eldamon class item is added automatically to eldamon when adding the ancestry.

You rearrange the elemental energies around you, refreshing your powers. You refresh all your active and reactive powers, allowing you to use them all again.

Special The Refresh activity gains your element's associated traits.

Requirements You haven't used a power or elemental surge yet this turn

You create a minor surge of your element in place of using a power. You can't use a power on this turn, but on your next turn, the first time you use an active power, you gain the elemental surge effect based on your element, just before or just after applying the power's normal effects (your choice). If the effect specifies that it affects a creature, it affects one creature of your choice that's either you, a target of your power, or a creature in the power's area. If the effect specifies that it affects you, you gain the benefit.

The eldamon has resistances and weaknesses to the listed damage types and traits equal to their level. The resistance and weakness are based on their element, so it will rarely vary between eldamon of the same element.
This eldamon has a mortal friend.

Eldamon have innate defenses from their elements that protect them from harm, akin to armor for mortals. This grants them a +2 item bonus to AC and a +3 Maximum Dexterity. Additionally, an eldamon with a mortal friend (whether or not they're an eldamon trainer) can share their friend's armor potency rune and resilient rune, granting them an increased item bonus to AC and an item bonus to saving throws

The element of mind encompasses the elemental nature of mental essence, the foundation of the Astral Plane, the Dreamlands, and other mental realms. Thus, it focuses on powers that assault, bewilder, or overwhelm the minds of others.

Lethal Trauma: Your mind powers are capable of causing enough psychic trauma to kill. When you use a mind power that deals mental damage, you can choose whether or not to give the power the nonlethal trait. If you don't, the power is potentially lethal.

Associated Damage Type: Mental

Associated Traits: Mental

Other Abilities

If your element is mind, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You can propel your body purely with your mind, though the movement is coarse. As long as you move in a straight line, the Stride action is a purely mental action for you, which means you can take it while paralyzed.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can slightly adjust the mental state of a creature within 20 feet. Normally this is a minor mood alteration, but it could potentially make it slightly easier or harder to succeed at a skill check in a social situation.

Elemental Resistance Your mind is resilient to mental effects, especially those that control your actions or emotions. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on saving throws against mental effects that cause the controlled condition or have the emotion trait, and you gain resistance equal to half your level against mental damage. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, your circumstance bonus on saving throws increases to +2.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can more significantly affect the mental state of a creature. This allows you to communicate information into their mind rapidly, with an effect similar to mindlink or to help a creature calm down, decreasing their frightened value by 1. At the GM's discretion, you might be able to perform other similar adjustments to a creature's mental state.

Elemental Senses You can detect nearby thoughts from other creatures. You gain thoughtsense as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet.

Elemental Shield The shield also grants a +1 circumstance bonus to Will saves.

Elemental Surge The chosen creature is stupefied 1 until the end of your next turn unless they succeed at a Will save against your power DC.

Enhanced Locomotion Your purely mental motion is especially refined. You can Stride and Step normally using only your mind, and if you have other Speeds, you can use the associated move actions with your mind as well, even if you would normally need to flap your wings to Fly or move your fins to Swim.

You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} with a mere glare. When you do, Demoralize loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and you don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language.

Your mind powers deal more damage to creatures whose mind is vulnerable due to being befuddled or afraid. You gain a status bonus to damage with your mind powers equal to the highest of a creature's stupefied value from any source or their frightened value they received from your mind powers, your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, or your mortal friend's Demoralize if you're an eldamon, to a maximum of +2. If you're an expert in power DCs, the maximum status bonus to damage with your mind powers is +3. If you're a master, the status bonus increases by 1 as long as a creature is either frightened or stupefied at any value, to a total maximum of +5, and if you're legendary, the status bonus increases by a total of 2 as long as a creature is frightened or stupefied at any value, to a total maximum of +6.

rules.label: Highest of stupefied or frightened you imposed on target

description.value: You use a mind amethyst to sled across scattered rubble, sand, or snow with ease. You ignore difficult terrain from rubble, sand, or snow.

You blast a cone of mental energy to muddle your foes' minds and throw them off their guard. You deal @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4+(ceil(@actor.level/2)))[mental]] damage to all foes in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], with effects depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

At 5th level, you can choose to increase the size of the cone to a @Template[type:cone|distance:20] when you use Addling Blast, and every 4 levels thereafter you can increase the size of the cone by 5 additional feet, to a maximum of @Template[type:cone|distance:35]{35 feet} at 17th level.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of their next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} and offguard, both until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and off-guard, both until the end of your next turn.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

You touch a foe and release overflowing mental energy into their vulnerable mind, damaging them and briefly weakening their mind. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack roll} against a foe within your reach, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[mental]] damage.

Critical Success You deal double mental damage and the foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} until the end of your next turn.

Success You deal normal mental damage and the foe is stupefied 2 until the end of your next turn.

Failure The foe manages to fight off the mental damage, but their mind is still briefly weakened. They are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure Your touch misses completely, and the foe is unaffected.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Trigger A creature hits you with a melee attack.

You use your foe's attack to establish a mental link to that foe, opening them up to your other mind powers. They must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes a –1 circumstance penalty to its Will saves against your mind powers for 1 round. During that time, it also gain weakness equal to 1 plus half your level to mental damage from your first mental power that damages it. After taking the additional damage from the weakness once, the weakness ends.

Failure As success, but the foe takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its Will saves against your mind powers, and the weakness is equal to 1 plus your level.

Critical Failure As success, but the foe takes a –3 circumstance penalty to its Will saves against your mind powers, and the weakness is equal to 2 plus twice your level.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.02zTjXrTz67CTGF7]{Effect: Retributive Mindlink}

You send a rush of mental energy through yourself and around you, allowing you to rapidly inspect your surroundings and query your memories or those of the friend whose phase you share while you rearrange the energy to use your powers again. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} three times, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} three times, or use any combination of the two three times. If you're an eldamon, your mortal friend Recalls Knowledge instead of you. You Refresh your powers.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.eldamon-features.Item.QZgXHHRPN7XqpSvR]{Eldamon Battler}

All of your eldamon increase their maximum Hit Points by an amount equal to your level (minimum 2).

Note: Place this effect on each of your Eldamon actors

You can call forth your element to protect you from harm. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.actions.Item.g8lH9enxTY6Cpx9V]{Elemental Shield} action. When you use Elemental Shield, it gains your element's associated trait or traits. When you use Elemental Shield, you can increase the circumstance bonus from Elemental Shield to +2 if you choose to hold the elemental shield in a free hand.

You call forth your element to form a shield, which floats above you, or in your hand for increased protection. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your AC until the beginning of your next turn from the elemental shield. You also gain the elemental shield benefit based on your element. If you use Elemental Shield again while your shield is still active, the previous shield ends and a new one appears.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.feats.Item.6sAJu5oEkHWPdbwm]{Elemental Steps}

All your trained eldamon increase their Speeds by 5 feet. Additionally, they can Step into difficult terrain.

Note: Place this effect on each of your Eldamon actors

You train your eldamon friends to enhance their natural eldamon resistances, making it harder to overload them with their own element or overcome them with an elemental they already resist. Your eldamon increase their natural eldamon resistances based on their element from an amount equal to their level to an amount equal to one and a half times their level, starting at resistance 3 at 2nd level and ending at resistance 30 at 20th level.

Note: Place this feature on each of your Eldamon actors

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.feats.Item.YiWDPrJu3OAFrnTI]{Focused Training}

You train your eldamon friends to broaden their capacity for various skills. For each of your eldamon friends, choose for them to become brawny, burglarious, enthralling, nimble, self-sufficient, sneaky, or terrifying. If your eldamon already has the skill associated with the focused training you chose, your eldamon gains one of the skills associated with another focused training as an eldamon skill instead. Like their other eldamon skills, your eldamon become trained in the skill gained from focused training, and the skill increases to expert at 5th level and then to master at 11th level.

  • Self-Sufficient: Your eldamon can handle themself and can track creatures easily. They gain Survival as an eldamon skill and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.urQZwmzg2kS53vd5]{Experienced Tracker} skill feat.

Note: Place this feature on your Eldamon actors

Tracking is second nature to you, and when necessary you can follow a trail without pause. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} while moving at full Speed by taking a –5 penalty to your Survival check. If you're a master in Survival, you don't take the –5 penalty. If you're legendary in Survival, you no longer need to roll a new Survival check every hour when tracking, though you still need to roll whenever there are significant changes in the trail.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.GNMy7NYfF3AQwHpN]{Divine Health}

You gain a +1 status bonus to saves against diseases and poisons.
